title: As a Non-Australian have you heard of the children’s show “Bluey?” If so, what are your thoughts and is it popular? - Quora

response.answer_text: It's on one of the kids channels on TV, I think Nick Jr, here in the US. We have satellite but I'm sure it's on cable too. I've seen bits and pieces when my kids watch it, but that's not very often. I got a kick out of one where they were playing “keep-y uppy", which has the uncreative name of “don't let the balloon hit the floor" here in the States.

I don’t have young children so I am not up to date with kids programs. I’ve herad of Bluey, a series of stories about a family Blue heeler dog. I hear it’s really good and good for the kids but I never watched it myself. Blue heeler dogs in general are very active and fun

Whether I’m non-Australian or not is irrelevant. I’ve lived here for over 35 years. I haven’t heard of “Bluey” because it’s a preschool show, released in 2018, and as my daughter hasn’t been a preschooler for 30 years, there’s no reason for me to watch it.
No I am way past the stage of watch a program like “Bluey”, so I cannot say anything about it. I did enjoy watching Skippy and The Sullivan’s as a child.
I haven't heard of the show, but don't watch television much to begin with. Thanks for the A2A anyway.
